page.title: 08Wordsworth House Cockermouth
page.content: Wordsworth House, birthplace of the poet laureate{William Wordsworth,}is a very large house for such a small town . The poet was born here in this house on{Main Street}in 1770 and his sister Dorothy was born there too. Nowadays the house is owned by the {National Trust}and is open to the public.On Sundays it is open from 14.00 to 17.00.On weekdays except Thursdays,it is open from 11.00 to 17.00 and 16.30 is the last admission time.The prices of admission is 60p for children and Â£1.20 for adults. The building at the front has 13 windows and a very grand door with 6 steps leading up to it.Two doric columns are on either side of the door holding up the porch roof.There are two floors and all the rooms are furnished with 18th century furniture.
